page.shortlink: api client api a5 chart generate method

argument.name: data
argument.description: The raw data to chart. If no data is passed in, then data will be needed to be placed in the settings object.

argument.name: settings
argument.description: The settings to use for the charting of the data.

property.name: input
property.description: The settings to define the data to input to the chart generate.

property.name: map
property.description: The definition of how to map the raw data into a format useable by the charting logic. If multiple data mappings want to be used an array of maps may be passed in. See *[link:A5.chart Definition Map Object]*.

property.name: output
property.description: The settings to define the output of the chart generate.

property.name: as
property.description: The output type. Values can be "string" (the default), which will return the HTML needed to draw the chart, or "object", which will return the object that is created durning the charting process and subsequently complied to HTML when the output type is "string".

property.name: render
property.description: The settings to control the drawing of the chart.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of chart to draw. Values can be "rect" or "polar" for two axis charts, and "linear" or "radial" for single axis charts.

property.name: palette
property.description: The name of the palette to use for the chart. The default is "base". See *[link:A5.chart.palettes]*.

property.name: stretch
property.description: If the value is true or "width" then the width of the chart will stretch to fill the containing element. A value of "both" will stretch both the width and height. A value of false will use the specified width and height.

property.name: width
property.description: The base width (in pixels) of the chart. The default is 600. This is used as the basis for the rendering of the chart, but depending on the specified stretch value does not need to be the final displayed width.

property.name: height
property.description: The base width (in pixels) of the chart. The default is 300. This is used as the basis for the rendering of the chart, but depending on the specified stretch value does not need to be the final displayed height.

property.name: offset
property.description: The settings to control the margins of the drawing area of the chart.

property.name: top
property.description: The base top offset (in pixels) of the chart. The default is 10.

property.name: bottom
property.description: The base bottom offset (in pixels) of the chart. The default is 10.

property.name: left
property.description: The base left offset (in pixels) of the chart. The default is 10.

property.name: right
property.description: The base right offset (in pixels) of the chart. The default is 10.

property.name: arc
property.description: If the chart type is "polar" or "radial", the definition of the arc the chart is drawn in.

property.name: start
property.description: The start angle in degrees with 0/360 being up. The default is 0.

property.name: end
property.description: The end angle in degrees with 0/360 being up. The default is 0.

property.name: margin
property.description: The margin from the outside edge of the arc to the nearest edges of the rectangular drawing area. The default is 10.

property.name: layer
property.description: One or more chart layer objects. If an array of layers is passed in then each layer will be rendered in sequence on top of the previous layers. See *[link:A5.chart Rect Layer Object]*, *[link:A5.chart Polar Layer Object]*, *[link:A5.chart Linear Layer Object]* and *[link:A5.chart Radial Layer Object]*

property.name: chart
property.description: The resulting chart.

property.name: above
property.description: The HTML drawn to the top of the chart plot area.

property.name: before
property.description: The HTML drawn to the left of the chart plot area.

property.name: html
property.description: The HTML for the chart plot area.

property.name: top
property.description: The top of the plot area.

property.name: bottom
property.description: The bottom of the plot area.

property.name: left
property.description: The left of the plot area.

property.name: right
property.description: The right of the plot area.

property.name: width
property.description: The width of the plot area.

property.name: height
property.description: The width of the plot area.

property.name: arc
property.description: For "polar" and "radial" charts, the definition of the arc being drawn.

property.name: start
property.description: The start angle of the arc in degrees with "0" being up.

property.name: end
property.description: The end angle of the arc in degrees with "0" being up.

property.name: length
property.description: The length of the arc in degrees from start to the end angle.

property.name: direction
property.description: The direction of the arc. A value of "1" being clockwise and "-1" being counterclockwise.

property.name: radius
property.description: The radius of the plotted arc.

property.name: after
property.description: The HTML drawn to the right of the chart plot area.

property.name: below
property.description: The HTML drawn to the bottom of the chart plot area.

discussion.p: The A5.chart.generate method is used to generate a chart. Either an HTML string or an object can be returned. Getting the chart returned as a object will allow for additional information to be gathered for use by external logic.
